result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Ronald Goodman, #230980 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $250.00 DNA surcharge to the COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be a judgment.
Subject to good time and work release = time served.

Must provide DNA sample.
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
May not possess or use firearms.
